VLIB Function Reference

Gaussian 5x5 Pyramid Kernel

Introduction and Use Cases

Gaussian image pyramid is a data structure consisting of the original image at level 0, 2x2 sub-sampled image at Level 1, further 2x2 sub-sampled image at Level 2, etc. It is commonly used in detection and tracking applications to reduce the amount of processing [1]

Specification

Function

This function can be used to calculate the next level of a pyramid. Given a pointer to a rectangular region of interest described by W (input data width), P (input data pitch), and H (input data height), this kernel returns (W-4)/2 x (H-3)/2 values. For example, if H=5, it will calculate a single row of results. The antialiasing filter used at each step is a binomial approximation to the 5x5 Gaussian filter given by: 
        1   4   6   4   1
        4   16  24  16  4
        6   24  36  24  6   /   256
        4   16  24  16  4
        1   4   6   4   1

Variants

This functionality is available in two variants: 8-bit and 16-bit

Inputs


    Parameter          Description                                 8-bit            16-bit
    -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    *pIn               Input image                                (UQ8.0)          (UQ16.0)
     width             Input width                                (UQ16.0)         (UQ16.0)
     pitch             Pitch of the input image                   (UQ16.0)         (UQ16.0)
     height            Input height                               (UQ16.0)         (UQ16.0)
    *pOut              Output image                               (UQ8.0)          (UQ16.0)

Outputs

    Returns VLIB Error Status

Method

Check specific API details for specific details.

APIS

  • VLIB_gauss5x5PyramidKernel_8
  • VLIB_gauss5x5PyramidKernel_16
